steps.title: Downloading and Installing Godot
steps.content:
Downloading

Let's get started by installing Godot.

The great thing about Godot is that getting it set up can take less than 30 seconds.

No, really!

Time yourself and see if you can follow these steps in under 30 seconds.

Click here to download Godot

The button above will take you to the download page. It will automatically take you to the version you need to grab for your system type (Mac, Windows, etc).

Click the button which looks like this (your version may be newer, which is fine) to download Godot.

Extracting

Godot comes in a zipped file to keep the size nice and small. This just means you will need to extract (or unzip) it first.

Extracting on a Mac device

Extracting on a Mac is nice and simple.

Just double click the file and you should be good to go!

Drag the unzipped folder where you want Godot to hang out (for example, your Desktop) to keep things nice and tidy.

Extracting on a Windows device

Right click on the file and click Extract Allâ€¦

This will create an unzipped folder with everything inside of it.

Drag this new unzipped folder where you want to keep it (for example, your Desktop) and you're good to go!

Running Godot

That was super easy, right?

Double click the application without _console at the end to run Godot.

That's it! We're ready to roll. Let's get to the fun stuff.

quiz.question: True or False: You need to install Godot to run it.

steps.title: Creating Our First Godot Project
steps.content:
Creating and Configuring a New Project

Let's get started by making a new project in Godot.

Start by clicking the + New button at the top left.

Give your project a name, like My First 2D Game. Don't worry, you can always change this later!

Click the Browse button to find the folder area you'd like to save your game in. Use the arrow (circled in green below) to go back up through your files.

It might take a bit of time, but use the arrow to go back and forth and find an area where you'd like your project to live. In my example, I'm going to pick the Desktop.

Use the Create Folder button to make a new folder to keep everything nice and tidy.

Make that new folder, then click Select Current Folder to make sure everything goes inside.

Once that's done, click Create & Edit to launch your first project!
